pasta-carbonara.title: Classic Pasta Carbonara
pasta-carbonara.description: Creamy Italian pasta with eggs, cheese, and pancetta

steps.instruction: Bring a large pot of water to boil
Cut pancetta into small cubes
Whisk eggs, yolks, Pecorino, and pepper in a bowl
Cook pancetta in a pan over medium heat until crispy
Add pasta to boiling water and cook until al dente
Remove pasta from heat, add to pancetta, then quickly stir in egg mixture
steps.notes: Off heat to avoid scrambling eggs

steps.instruction: Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and pepper

zucchini-with-pine-nuts-and-ham-wrapped-.title: Zucchini with Pine Nuts and Ham-Wrapped Pears
zucchini-with-pine-nuts-and-ham-wrapped-.description: A delightful dish with baked zucchini slices, roasted pine nuts, marinated arugula, and pears wrapped in ham, garnished with pomegranate seeds and balsamic cream.

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220°C (200°C fan). Cut the ends off the zucchini and slice into 2-3 mm thin slices. Lay the zucchini slices on a baking tray lined with baking paper.
steps.notes: Use 1 tbsp of oil for 2 servings, scale accordingly.

steps.instruction: Drizzle the zucchini slices with oil, season with salt and pepper, and bake for about 10-15 minutes until soft and beginning to brown.
Cut the pear into eighths and core it. Halve the pomegranate and remove the seeds by tapping the halves over a bowl with a spoon. Wash the lemon, zest the peel, then quarter it.
Halve the ham slices lengthwise. Wrap each pear slice with a halved ham slice lengthwise.
In a large dry pan, roast the pine nuts for 2-3 minutes until fragrant, stirring frequently to prevent burning.
steps.notes: Be attentive as pine nuts burn easily.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of oil, juice from 1-2 lemon wedges, salt, pepper and a pinch of sugar to make a dressing. Marinate the arugula in this dressing shortly before serving.
steps.notes: Adjust oil and lemon quantities according to servings.

steps.instruction: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan over medium heat. In batches, cook the ham-wrapped pear slices for 3-4 minutes, turning gently until the ham is crispy.

Arrange the baked zucchini slices in a circle on serving plates. Drizzle some dressing and balsamic cream over them. Sprinkle grated hard cheese, pine nuts, and lemon zest on top. Place marinated arugula in the center of the plate, arrange the ham-wrapped pear slices on top, and garnish with pomegranate seeds.
steps.notes: Serve immediately.

zucchini-schinken-birne-salat-mit-pinien.title: Zucchini-Schinken-Birne-Salat mit Pinienkernen
zucchini-schinken-birne-salat-mit-pinien.description: Ein frischer und leckerer Salat mit Zucchinischeiben, Schinken, Birnenspalten, geraspeltem Hartkäse, Pinienkernen und Granatapfelkernen, verfeinert mit Dressing und Balsamico-Crème.

steps.instruction: Enden der Zucchini abschneiden. Zucchini in 2-3 mm dünne Scheiben schneiden oder hobeln. Zucchinischeiben auf ein mit Backpapier belegtes Backblech geben, 1 EL (für 4 Portionen, entsprechend weniger oder mehr für andere Portionen) Öl darüber verteilen, mit Salz und Pfeffer würzen. Ca. 10-15 Min. backen, bis sie weich sind und anfangen zu bräunen.
steps.notes: Backofen auf 220 °C Ober-/Unterhitze vorheizen.

steps.instruction: Birne achteln und Kerne abschneiden. Granatapfel halbieren, Hälften rundherum etwas zusammendrücken und in eine kleine Schüssel halten. Mit einem Löffel auf der Außenseite klopfen, damit die Kerne herausfallen. Zitrone heiß abwaschen, Schale abreiben und Zitrone vierteln.
Schinkenscheiben längs halbieren und jeweils eine Scheibe um eine Birnenspalte wickeln.
In einer großen Pfanne ohne Fett Pinienkerne 2-3 Minuten rösten, bis sie duften. Dabei bleiben, da Pinienkerne schnell verbrennen.
steps.notes: Aufpassen, dass sie nicht verbrennen.

steps.instruction: In einer großen Schüssel aus 2 EL Öl (für 2 Portionen, für 4 Portionen entsprechend 4 EL), dem Saft von 1-2 Zitronenspalten, Salz, Pfeffer und einer Prise Zucker ein Dressing anrühren. Kurz vor dem Anrichten Rucola in dem Dressing marinieren. In einer Pfanne 1 EL Öl bei mittlerer Hitze erwärmen. Schinken-Birnen rundherum 3-4 Min. anbraten, bis der Schinken knusprig ist.

Zucchinischeiben kreisförmig auf Tellern anrichten. Etwas Dressing und Balsamico-Crème darüber träufeln. Geraspelten Hartkäse, geröstete Pinienkerne und eine Prise Zitronenabrieb darüber geben. Marinierten Rucola in der Mitte hoch anrichten. Birnenspalten mit Schinken darauflegen und mit Granatapfelkernen garnieren.

hahnchenbrust-mit-brokkoli-paprikasosse.title: Hähnchenbrust mit Brokkoli & Paprikasoße
hahnchenbrust-mit-brokkoli-paprikasosse.description: Knusprige Hähnchenbrustfilets mit Brokkoli, Jasminreis und einer leckeren Paprikasoße. Ein ausgewogenes Gericht für 2 bis 4 Personen.

ingredients.name: Öl
ingredients.notes: Zum Beträufeln der Hähnchenbrüste und zum Anbraten der Paprikasuße.

ingredients.name: Wasser
ingredients.notes: Zum Reiskochen, sowie ausreichend zum Brokkoli kochen und Soße zubereiten.

ingredients.name: Salz
ingredients.notes: Zum Würzen von Wasser, Reis, Brokkoli und Soße.

steps.instruction: Reis in einem Sieb mit kaltem Wasser so lange abspülen, bis das Wasser klar hindurchfließt. In einen kleinen Topf 300 ml [450 ml | 600 ml] heißes Wasser füllen, leicht salzen* und einmal aufkochen lassen. Reis einrühren und bei niedriger Hitze ca. 10 Min. abgedeckt köcheln lassen. Danach den Topf vom Herd nehmen und mindestens 10 Min. abgedeckt ziehen lassen.
steps.notes: Reis unbedingt vorher gut spülen.

steps.instruction: Pankomehl und geriebenen Hartkäse auf einem tiefen Teller miteinander vermengen. Hähnchenbrüste in eine große Schüssel geben und komplett mit Mayonnaise vermengen, bis diese vollständig überzogen sind. Hähnchenbrüste in der Käse-Panko-Mischung wälzen und diese fest andrücken. Panierte Hähnchenbrüste auf einem mit Backpapier belegten Backblech verteilen, mit 1 EL [1,5 EL | 2 EL] Öl beträufeln und im vorgeheizten Ofen bei 220 °C Ober-/Unterhitze (200 °C Umluft) für 14–18 Min. goldbraun backen, bis sie innen nicht mehr rosa sind.
steps.notes: Backofen vorheizen auf 220 °C.

steps.instruction: Einen großen Topf mit reichlich heißem Wasser füllen, salzen* und zum Kochen bringen. Paprika halbieren, Kerngehäuse entfernen und Paprikahälften in 1 cm dünne Streifen schneiden. Brokkoli in mundgerechte Röschen schneiden oder brechen.
steps.notes: Brokkoli und Paprika während das Hähnchen backt vorbereiten.

steps.instruction: In einer großen Pfanne 1 EL [1,5 EL | 2 EL] Öl erhitzen und Paprikastreifen darin 4–6 Min. farblos anschwitzen. Pfanneninhalt mit 50 ml [75 ml | 100 ml] Wasser*, Hühnerbrühpulver, Gewürzmischung "Hello Paprika" und Kochsahne ablöschen, alles verrühren und weitere 2 Min. köcheln lassen, bis die Soße etwas eingedickt ist. Soße mit Salz* und Pfeffer* abschmecken.
Brokkoliröschen im großen Topf für 3–4 Min. gar kochen und anschließend durch ein Sieb abgießen.
Reis nach der Kochzeit mit einer Gabel etwas auflockern. Knusprige Hähnchenbrüste, Brokkoli, Reis und Paprikasoße auf Tellern anrichten und genießen.

glasnudelsalat-mit-hackfleisch-und-gemue.title: Glasnudelsalat mit Hackfleisch und Gemüse
glasnudelsalat-mit-hackfleisch-und-gemue.description: Ein leckerer Glasnudelsalat mit Hackfleisch, frischem Gemüse und einem pikanten Dressing mit Limette, Sojasoße und Chili.

ingredients.name: Glasnudeln
ingredients.notes: Beachte, die Menge weicht durch Quellen ab.

ingredients.name: Frühlingszwiebel
ingredients.notes: Weißer und grüner Teil getrennt schneiden.

ingredients.name: Zucchini
ingredients.notes: Enden abschneiden, längs halbieren und in Streifen hobeln.

steps.instruction: Chili halbieren, entkernen und Chilihälften fein hacken (Achtung: scharf!). Weißen und grünen Teil der Frühlingszwiebeln getrennt voneinander in feine Ringe schneiden. Knoblauch abziehen und fein hacken. Karotte schälen und mit einem Gemüseschäler in längliche Streifen hobeln. Enden der Zucchini abschneiden, längs halbieren und mit dem Sparschäler in Streifen hobeln.
steps.notes: Tipp: Falls Hobeln zu aufwendig ist, kannst du Zucchini und Karotte auch in dünne Scheiben oder Stifte schneiden.

steps.instruction: Limette heiß abwaschen, Schale fein abreiben und Limette vierteln. In einer kleinen Schale Limettenabrieb, Saft aus 2 Limettenvierteln, Sojasoße, gehackten Chili nach Geschmack und eine Prise Zucker zu einem Dressing verrühren.

In einem großen Topf reichlich heißes Wasser füllen, kräftig salzen und einmal aufkochen lassen. Topf vom Herd nehmen und Glasnudeln darin 5–7 Minuten einweichen, bis sie weich sind. Glasnudeln nach der Garzeit in ein Sieb abgießen, mit kaltem Wasser spülen und abtropfen lassen.
In einer großen Pfanne 1–2 TL Öl erhitzen. Hackfleisch darin für 6–8 Minuten krümelig anbraten, bis es durch und alle Flüssigkeit verkocht ist. Herd ausschalten und Bulgogisoße unterrühren.

In einer zweiten Pfanne 1–2 TL Öl erhitzen, weißen Teil der Frühlingszwiebel, gehackten Knoblauch, gehobelte Karotten und Zucchini hinzufügen und für 3–5 Minuten anschwitzen. Glasnudeln und Dressing hinzufügen, gut vermengen und für 1–2 Minuten anbraten. Mit Salz und Pfeffer abschmecken. Blätter vom Koriander abpfen und fein hacken.

Glasnudelsalat auf Tellern verteilen und Hackfleisch dazu anrichten. Mit Erdnüssen und grünem Teil der Frühlingszwiebel toppen. Nach Belieben gehackten Koriander und Chili darüberstreuen. Restliche Limettenspalten dazureichen.

gemuese-lachs-mit-porree-und-linsen.title: Gemüse Lachs mit Porree und Linsen
gemuese-lachs-mit-porree-und-linsen.description: Ein leckeres Gericht mit Karotten, Sellerie, Porree, Chili und Linsen, serviert mit Lachs. Einfach zuzubereiten und perfekt für 2-4 Personen.

ingredients.name: Karotte DE
ingredients.notes: Karotte schälen und in kleine Würfel schneiden.

ingredients.name: Porree (NL|BE|DE)
ingredients.notes: Porree in 0,5 cm breite Ringe schneiden.

ingredients.name: rote Chilischote (ES|NL|MA)
ingredients.notes: Chilischote scharf, halbieren, Kerne entfernen und in feine Stücke schneiden.

ingredients.name: Schnittlauch/Thymian
ingredients.notes: Thymianblätter abzupfen und grob hacken, Schnittlauch in feine Röllchen schneiden.

ingredients.name: Salz*
ingredients.notes: Zum Würzen des Gemüses und der Soße.

ingredients.name: Öl
ingredients.notes: Zum Braten des Gemüses und Würzen des Lachsfilets.

steps.instruction: Karotte schälen. Karotte und Selleriestange in kleine Würfel schneiden. Porree in 0,5 cm breite Ringe schneiden. Chili längs halbieren, Kerngehäuse entfernen und Chilihälften in feine Stücke schneiden. (Achtung: scharf!)
Blätter vom Thymian abzupfen und grob hacken. Schnittlauch in feine Röllchen schneiden.

1 EL Öl bei mittlerer Hitze in einer großen Pfanne erwärmen. Karotten- und Selleriewürfel, Porreeringe, Chiliringe (Achtung: scharf!), gehackten Thymian und Schnittlauch in die Pfanne geben und 8-12 Minuten braten, bis das Gemüse weich ist. Mit Salz würzen.
steps.notes: Gemüse muss weich sein.

steps.instruction: Lachsfilets mit Salz, Pfeffer und 1 EL Öl würzen. Lachs auf einem mit Backpapier belegten Backblech im vorgeheizten Ofen bei 220 °C Ober-/Unterhitze (200 °C Umluft) 12-14 Minuten backen, bis der Fisch innen nicht mehr glasig ist.
steps.notes: Backofen vorheizen.

steps.instruction: Linsen in einem Sieb unter kaltem Wasser abspülen, bis das Wasser klar hindurchläuft. Linsen zum Gemüse geben. Gemüsebrühpulver und Sahne zum Gemüse geben und nochmals aufkochen, bis die Soße cremig und eingedickt ist. Mit Salz und Pfeffer abschmecken.
Cremiges Porreegemüse auf Teller geben, Lachs darauf anrichten und genießen.

oven-roasted-sweet-potatoes-with-tomato-.title: Oven Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Tomato Salsa, Beans, and Guacamole
oven-roasted-sweet-potatoes-with-tomato-.description: A delicious recipe for oven-roasted sweet potatoes served with fresh tomato salsa, spiced beans, and creamy guacamole, topped with lime and herbs. Perfect for 2 to 4 people.

ingredients.name: tomato
ingredients.notes: stalk removed, chopped into 1 cm cubes

ingredients.name: red chili pepper
ingredients.notes: use cautiously as chili heat varies

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220 °C (upper/lower heat) or 200 °C with convection. Halve the unpeeled sweet potatoes lengthwise and prick them several times with a fork. Season with oil, salt, and pepper, then place cut side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
steps.notes: Use middle rack for baking.

steps.instruction: Bake the prepared sweet potatoes in the preheated oven on the middle rack for 30 to 35 minutes until they are soft.

Cut the chili pepper in half, remove seeds and veins, then cut into fine strips (careful: it is hot!). Separate the white and green parts of the spring onions and cut them into fine rings. Drain kidney beans and corn in a sieve and rinse under water until clear. Peel garlic and finely chop the herbs.

Halve tomatoes, remove stalks, and dice into 1 cm cubes. Place diced tomatoes in a small bowl. Add oil, sugar, juice of lime wedges, spring onion rings, and chili strips. Mix well and season with salt and pepper to taste.
steps.notes: Adjust chili quantity based on heat preference.

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add white spring onion rings and sauté for 1 to 2 minutes. Add garlic, beans, and corn and continue to cook all together. Add "Hello Fiesta" seasoning mix and fry for another 2 to 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Wash lime well and zest the skin. Halve the lime and cut into 6 (for 2 servings) or 12 (for 4 servings) wedges. In a small bowl, mix lime zest with sour cream, salt, and pepper. Halve avocado, remove the stone, scoop the flesh into another small bowl, and mash coarsely with a fork. Squeeze juice from 2 (for 2 servings) or 3 (for 4 servings) lime wedges into the avocado mix. Add half of the chopped herbs and season with salt and pepper.

Remove sweet potatoes from the oven and turn halves cut side up. Spread butter and cheese on top, then mash the filling with a fork. Serve sweet potato halves on plates, distribute bean-corn mix over them. Add tomato salsa and guacamole on top. Garnish with lime zest, remaining herbs, and lime wedges. Enjoy!

miniballs-with-chili-mayo-and-vegetable-.title: Mini Bällchen mit Chili-Mayonnaise und Gemüsesalat
miniballs-with-chili-mayo-and-vegetable-.description: Kleine Hackfleischbällchen mit würziger Chili-Mayonnaise und frischem Gemüsesalat aus Karotten, Gurken und Radieschen – ein leckeres und einfaches Gericht für 2 bis 4 Personen.

steps.instruction: Limette heiß waschen und Limettenschale abreiben. In einer großen Schüssel Hackfleisch mit 1 TL (für 2 Personen), 1,5 TL (3 Personen) oder 2 TL (4 Personen) Limettenabrieb, Sweet-Chili-Soße, etwas Salz und Pfeffer gut verkneten. Aus der Masse 12 (2 Personen), 18 (3 Personen) oder 24 (4 Personen) Minibällchen formen und kurz kalt stellen.
Karotten schälen und in dünne lange Streifen hobeln. Gurke in dünne Scheiben schneiden. Radieschen grob raspeln. Blätter der Minze abzupfen und fein hacken. Limette halbieren.

Limette in eine große Schüssel pressen und mit 1 EL (2 P), 1 EL (3 P) oder 2 EL (4 P) Zucker und restlichem Limettenabrieb zu einem Dressing verrühren. Gurkenscheiben, Karottenstreifen, geraspelte Radieschen und gehackte Minze hinzufügen, umrühren und marinieren lassen.
steps.notes: Dressing marinieren lassen

steps.instruction: Brot 5 – 8 Min. im Ofen backen bis es knusprig ist. In einer kleinen Schüssel Mayonnaise mit Siracha-Soße verrühren. Nach Geschmack mit Salz und Pfeffer nachwürzen.
steps.notes: Brot im Ofen backen

steps.instruction: In einer großen Pfanne mit mittlerer Stufe 1 EL (2 P), 1,5 EL (3 P) oder 2 EL (4 P) Öl erhitzen. Minibällchen in die Pfanne geben, etwas platt drücken und je Seite 3 - 4 Min. anbraten, bis das Fleisch durchgegart ist. Währenddessen Brot senkrecht halbieren, Brothälften aufschneiden (nicht ganz durchschneiden) und mit Chili-Mayonnaise bestreichen.
steps.notes: Minibällchen platt drücken für gleichmäßiges Braten

steps.instruction: Brothälften mit Gurkenscheiben belegen und Minibällchen darauf anrichten. Mit Karotte und Radieschen belegen und nach Belieben Koriander darauf anrichten. Brot zusammenklappen und mit dem restlichen Salat genießen.
steps.notes: Tipp: Koriander hat einen besonderen Geschmack, probier ihn lieber bevor du ihn benutzt.

zucchini-eggplant-ratatouille-bruschetta.title: Zucchini-Eggplant Ratatouille with Garlic Bruschetta
zucchini-eggplant-ratatouille-bruschetta.description: A delicious ratatouille with zucchini, eggplant, and peppers baked with Italian herbs, served with flavorful garlic bruschetta topped with herb-seasoned cheese and basil.

ingredients.name: zucchini
ingredients.notes: Cut ends off and dice into 2cm cubes

ingredients.name: eggplant
ingredients.notes: Cut ends off and dice into 2cm cubes

ingredients.name: garlic cloves
ingredients.notes: Clove count for roasting and bruschetta

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220°C top/bottom heat (200°C fan).

Wash vegetables and herbs. Halve the peppers, remove seeds and cut pepper halves into approximately 1 cm thick strips. Cut ends off zucchini and eggplant, then dice both into approx. 2 cm cubes. Pick leaves off oregano and chop roughly.

On a baking tray lined with parchment paper, distribute the pepper strips, oregano, zucchini, and eggplant cubes, leaving some space for the ciabatta. Drizzle with oil (depending on serving size: 1, 1.5, or 2 tablespoons), season with some salt and pepper, and bake on middle rack for about 15 minutes until the vegetables are soft.

Peel and dice the garlic and onion. In a small pot, heat 1 tablespoon (2 EL for 3 servings, 2 EL for 4 servings) of oil on medium heat, press half of the garlic and sweat with the diced onion for about 3 minutes. Deglaze with the tomato sauce, add half (for 2 servings), three quarters (for 3 servings), or the whole amount (for 4 servings) of the spice mix 'Hello Smokey', and simmer the sauce for 2–3 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.

Press the remaining garlic into a small bowl and mix with 2 tablespoons (3 EL for 3 servings, 4 EL for 4 servings) of oil and the spice mix 'Hello Buon Appetito'. Slice the ciabatta lengthwise, brush with the spiced oil, season with salt and pepper to taste, then bake in the oven for 6–8 minutes until crispy alongside the vegetables.
Pick leaves off basil and chop roughly. Crumble the herding cheese with your hands in a small bowl. Mix the cheese with the chopped basil and lightly season with pepper.
Cut the ciabatta halves into large pieces. Distribute the ratatouille on plates, spoon the tomato sauce and herding cheese mixture over the top, and enjoy together with the garlic bruschetta.

bulgur-spitzpaprika-salat-mit-avocado-un.title: Bulgur Spitzpaprika Salat mit Avocado und Zwiebel-Joghurt-Dip
bulgur-spitzpaprika-salat-mit-avocado-un.description: Ein frischer Salat mit gekochtem Bulgur, gebackenen Spitzpaprika, karamellisierten Zwiebeln und einem Minz-Joghurt-Dip, serviert mit Avocado und Spinat. Perfekt für 2 bis 4 Personen als gesunde Mahlzeit.

ingredients.name: Pistazien
ingredients.notes: Grob gehackt, für die Füllung der Spitzpaprika

ingredients.name: Zwiebel
ingredients.notes: Geschält und in feine Streifen geschnitten

ingredients.name: Avocado
ingredients.notes: Halbiert, entsteint und in Scheiben geschnitten

ingredients.name: Olivenöl
ingredients.notes: Zum Beträufeln der Spitzpaprika und für den Dip

steps.instruction: In einen kleinen Topf 350 ml (für 2 Personen) / 470 ml (für 3 Personen) / 700 ml (für 4 Personen) kochendes Wasser füllen. Gewürzmischung und Salz zugeben und einmal aufkochen lassen. Bulgur einrühren und bei niedriger Hitze ca. 15 Min. abgedeckt köcheln lassen. Dann Topf vom Herd nehmen und mindestens 10 Min. abgedeckt ziehen lassen.
steps.notes: Wasser zum Kochen bringen, dann Bulgur garen.

steps.instruction: Spitzpaprika halbieren, Kerne und Strunk entfernen. Spitzpaprika auf ein mit Backpapier belegtes Backblech legen und mit 1 EL (für 2 Personen), 1,5 EL (für 3 Personen) bzw. 2 EL (für 4 Personen) Olivenöl beträufeln. Pistazien grob hacken. Hirtenkäse mit den Händen in die Spitzpaprika bröseln. Pistazien darüber verteilen. Auf der Mittelschiene im Ofen 15–20 Min. backen, bis die Spitzpaprika weich sind.
ingredients: Spitzpaprika (nicht in ingredient list, use 2-4 depending)
steps.notes: Backofen auf 220°C Ober- und Unterhitze vorheizen.

steps.instruction: Blätter von Petersilie und Minze abzupfen und getrennt voneinander fein hacken. Zwiebel abziehen, halbieren und in feine Streifen schneiden. In einer kleinen Pfanne 1 EL (für 2 Personen), 1,5 EL (für 3 Personen) bzw. 2 EL (für 4 Personen) Olivenöl erhitzen. Zwiebelstreifen darin bei mittlerer Temperatur 8–10 Min. glasig dünsten. Mit Balsamicocreme ablöschen und auf der ausgeschalteten Herdplatte stehen lassen.
steps.notes: Zwiebeln langsam glasig dünsten.

steps.instruction: Limette heiß abwaschen, Schale der Limette fein abreiben. Limette in 6 (bei 2 Personen), 6 (bei 3 Personen) bzw. 12 (bei 4 Personen) Spalten schneiden. In einer großen Schüssel Saft von 1 (2P), 1,5 (3P) bzw. 2 (4P) Limettenspalten, 1 EL (2P), 1,5 EL (3P) bzw. 2 EL (4P) Olivenöl, süßen Senf, Salz und Pfeffer verrühren. Spinat unterheben.
steps.notes: Dressing anrühren und Spinat unterheben.

steps.instruction: In einer kleinen Schüssel Sahnejoghurt mit Minze und einigen Tropfen Limettensaft verrühren. Mit Salz und Pfeffer abschmecken. Avocado halbieren, Stein entfernen, Fruchtfleisch herauslösen und quer in Scheiben schneiden.
steps.notes: Frischen Minz-Joghurt-Dip zubereiten.

steps.instruction: Bulgur mit dem Saft von 1 (2P), 1,5 (3P) bzw. 2 (4P) Limettenspalten nach Geschmack, gehackter Petersilie und 1 TL (2P), 1,5 TL (3P) bzw. 2 TL (4P) Limettenabrieb mischen und auf tiefe Teller geben. Spinatsalat, Avocado, Spitzpaprika und karamellisierte Zwiebeln darauf verteilen und mit Minzjoghurt genießen.
steps.notes: Alles ansprechend anrichten und servieren.

marinated-grilled-chicken-legs-with-tabo.title: Marinated Grilled Chicken Legs with Tabbouleh and Mint Yogurt
marinated-grilled-chicken-legs-with-tabo.description: A flavorful dish featuring marinated and grilled chicken legs served with fresh tabbouleh and creamy mint yogurt, complemented by crunchy cashew nuts.

ingredients.name: Bulgur
ingredients.notes: Use as per number of servings

ingredients.name: Yogurt
ingredients.notes: To mix with herbs and seasonings for mint yogurt

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.notes: Boiling water for bulgur preparation and marinade

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.notes: Used in marinade and mint yogurt dressing

steps.instruction: Wash vegetables and herbs thoroughly. Wash chicken legs thoroughly before preparation.
steps.notes: Washing chicken legs removes any vacuum packaging odor.

steps.instruction: Heat water to boiling (350 ml for 2 servings, 525 ml for 3 servings, 700 ml for 4 servings).
steps.notes: Use water for bulgur preparation and marinade.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, mix 2 tbsp oil (for 2 servings; 3 tbsp for 3; 4 tbsp for 4) with 1 tsp lemon zest (adjust for servings as 1 to 2 tsp), 2 tbsp lemon juice, pepper, and salt. Stir well.
steps.notes: Ensure lemon zest is finely grated.

steps.instruction: Turn chicken legs in the marinade to coat well. Let marinate while preparing other ingredients.
steps.notes: Ensure all legs are well covered.

steps.instruction: Place chicken legs skin side down on grill and grill for about 22–30 minutes, turning regularly to crisp all sides.
steps.notes: Wrap garlic in foil and grill for about 5 minutes alongside chicken.

steps.instruction: Put boiling water (350 ml for 2 servings; 525 ml for 3; 700 ml for 4) in a small pot, add vegetable broth powder, lightly salt, and bring to a boil once.
steps.notes: Prepare bulgur for cooking.

steps.instruction: Stir in bulgur, cover pot, turn off heat, and let bulgur soak for about 25 minutes until water is fully absorbed.
steps.notes: Do not stir during soaking.

steps.instruction: Pick mint and parsley leaves and chop herbs separately. In a small bowl, mix chopped mint with yogurt, salt, pepper, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tbsp olive oil, and pressed garlic.
steps.notes: Press garlic from foil before mixing.

steps.instruction: Halve tomatoes, remove stems, and dice into 0.5 cm cubes. Cut spring onions into thin rings. Cut ends off cucumber and dice into 0.5 cm cubes. Crumble feta cheese with hands.
steps.notes: Fresh and evenly chopped ingredients improve texture and taste.

steps.instruction: Combine tomato, spring onion, cucumber, feta, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl to make the dressing. Mix everything thoroughly.
steps.notes: Adjust seasoning to taste.

steps.instruction: Coarsely chop cashew nuts.
steps.notes: Can be done while bulgur soaks.

steps.instruction: If needed, drain excess water from bulgur and fluff with a fork. Mix bulgur under tabbouleh and place on serving plates.
steps.notes: Fluff bulgur to keep it light.

steps.instruction: Arrange grilled chicken legs on plates alongside tabbouleh. Sprinkle chopped cashew nuts over, add a spoonful of mint yogurt, and enjoy.
steps.notes: Serve immediately for best flavor.

vegetarische-moussaka-mit-aubergine-lins.title: Vegetarische Moussaka mit Aubergine und Linsen
vegetarische-moussaka-mit-aubergine-lins.description: Eine köstliche vegetarische Moussaka mit Auberginen, Linsen und Kartoffelwürfeln, überbacken mit einer Frischkäse-Mischung und Käse-Mix. Perfekt für 2 bis 4 Personen.

steps.instruction: Linsen durch ein Sieb abgießen und mit Wasser spülen, bis dieses klar hindurchfließt. Enden der Aubergine abschneiden und Aubergine in ca. 0,5 cm dicke Scheiben schneiden.

In einer großen Auflaufform stückige Tomaten, Linsen, Kartoffelwürfel, Gemüsebrühe, Honig und Gewürzmischung "Hello Souflaki" vermengen. Mit Zucker, Salz und Pfeffer würzen und gleichmäßig auf dem Boden der Auflaufform verteilen.
steps.notes: Für 4 Personen am besten 2 Auflaufformen verwenden.

steps.instruction: Auf der Hälfte eines mit Backpapier belegten Backblechs die Auberginenscheiben ausbreiten. Mit Olivenöl beträufeln und mit Salz und Pfeffer würzen. Bei 220 °C Ober-/Unterhitze ca. 20 Minuten backen, bis sie etwas weicher sind.
steps.notes: Für 3 oder 4 Personen ein ganzes Backblech verwenden.

steps.instruction: Frischkäse und Gewürzmischung "Hello Muskat" mit heißem Wasser glatt rühren. Tomate in 2 cm große Würfel schneiden. Salatherz halbieren, Strunk herausschneiden und in Streifen schneiden.

Auflaufform aus dem Ofen nehmen und gut durchmengen. Vorgebackene Auberginenscheiben auf dem Auflauf verteilen, Frischkäse-Mischung darüber geben, mit Käse-Mix bestreuen und weitere 10–12 Minuten im Ofen gratinieren lassen. Danach mit Küchenpapier die Auflaufform auswischen.

In einer großen Schüssel Balsamico-Crème und Olivenöl verrühren. Dressing mit Salz und Pfeffer abschmecken. Tomate und Salat unter das Dressing heben. Vegetarische Moussaka auf Teller verteilen, Salat daneben anrichten und genießen.

beef-burger-garden-style-risotto.title: Beef Burger Garden Style Risotto
beef-burger-garden-style-risotto.description: A delicious risotto with mushrooms, bacon, pear, walnuts, and caramelized flavors, topped with grated hard cheese and chives.

ingredients.name: Olivenöl, Wasser, Zucker, Salz, Pfeffer
ingredients.notes: used as needed for cooking and seasoning

steps.instruction: In a large pot, heat 1 EL olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic for about 1 minute. Add risotto rice and sauté for another minute. Deglaze with a little chicken broth and cook risotto on low heat for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally and adding broth gradually as needed.
steps.notes: Stir continuously to prevent sticking.

steps.instruction: Slice mushrooms. Quarter pear, remove core, and halve pieces again. Cut chives into fine rolls.
Place bacon slices in a large cold pan and fry over medium heat for about 5 minutes, turning occasionally until crispy. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan without additional fat, fry sliced mushrooms for 3-4 minutes, season with salt and pepper, then add to the risotto.
Wipe pan with kitchen paper, then add pear slices and walnuts. Fry for about 3 minutes. Sprinkle 0.5 to 1 EL sugar over and let caramelize gently for 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir grated hard cheese into the finished risotto, then spread on plates. Top with caramelized pear slices, walnuts, crispy bacon slices, and sprinkle with chive rolls. Serve and enjoy.

bulgogi-sweet-chili-burger-with-roasted-.title: Bulgogi Sweet Chili Burger with Roasted Vegetable Slices
bulgogi-sweet-chili-burger-with-roasted-.description: A flavorful recipe featuring bulgogi-seasoned ground beef burgers paired with sweet chili mayonnaise and roasted vegetable slices, including sweet potato and green beans, served with a baguette.

ingredients.name: Steinofenbaguette
ingredients.notes: Use 1 to 2 pieces depending on serving size

ingredients.name: Grüne Paprika (green bell pepper)
ingredients.notes: Halved, deseeded, cut into 1 cm wide strips

ingredients.name: Süßkartoffel (sweet potato)
ingredients.notes: Halved lengthwise, then quartered lengthwise and sliced into 1 cm thick pieces

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220°C (top and bottom heat) or 200°C (fan). Gather 1 baking dish, 1 baking tray lined with baking paper, a small bowl, and a vegetable grater.
steps.notes: Heated oven before starting preparation.

steps.instruction: Peel the onion, quarter it and separate the layers. Halve the green bell pepper, remove seeds and stem, then cut into 1 cm wide strips. Halve the sweet potato lengthwise, then quarter lengthwise and slice into 1 cm thick slices.
steps.notes: Prepare vegetables before mixing.

steps.instruction: Put the ground beef, quartered onion, and green pepper strips into a baking dish. Add bulgogi sauce and sesame seeds, then mix well.
steps.notes: Mix thoroughly to distribute sauce and seeds.

steps.instruction: Peel and coarsely grate the carrot. Pick coriander leaves. Halve the baguette crosswise and then slice horizontally.
steps.notes: Prepare carrot and baguette for assembly.

steps.instruction: In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and sweet chili sauce with salt and pepper to make the dip. Stir well.
steps.notes: Adjust seasoning to taste.

steps.instruction: Place the baking dish on the side of the baking tray lined with baking paper. Arrange the sweet potato slices on the other side. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Bake everything in the middle of the oven for 25-30 minutes. Add the baguette during the last 5-10 minutes of baking time.
steps.notes: If space is tight, you can use two baking trays.

steps.instruction: Put the grated carrot into the baking dish and mix with the Bulgogi mixture. Spread both sides of the baguette with the sweet chili mayonnaise. Fill the baguette with the bulldogi mixture and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve the sweet potato slices with the remaining sweet chili mayonnaise.
steps.notes: Assemble while filling is warm for best flavor.

ofen-ratatouille-mit-walnussen-und-mozza.title: Ofen-Ratatouille mit Walnüssen und Mozzarella
ofen-ratatouille-mit-walnussen-und-mozza.description: Ein leckeres Ofen-Ratatouille mit Auberginen, Zucchini, Kartoffeln, Walnüssen und Mozzarella, überbacken mit Hartkäseflocken, serviert mit einem frischen Salat aus Rucola und Dressing.

steps.instruction: Wasche das Gemüse. Heize den Backofen auf 220°C Ober-/Unterhitze (200°C Umluft) vor. Schneide von der Aubergine und Zucchini die Enden ab und schneide jeweils ca. 0,5 cm dicke Scheiben. Schäle die Kartoffel und schneide auch 0,5 cm dicke Scheiben. Ziehe die Zwiebel ab, halbiere sie und schneide feine Halbringe. Ziehe den Knoblauch ab.
steps.notes: Damit die Aubergine nicht bitter schmeckt, sofort nach dem Schneiden salzen und nach ca. 10 Min. trocken tupfen.

steps.instruction: Röste die Walnusskerne in einer großen Pfanne ohne Fett für 2–3 Minuten, bis sie anfangen zu duften. Nimm sie heraus und lasse sie auskühlen. Erhitze 1 EL Olivenöl in der Pfanne, gib die Zwiebel dazu, presse den Knoblauch hinein und dünste beides für 2–3 Minuten glasig. Gib die Gewürzmischung "Hello Harissa" dazu und röste alles einmal durch. Rühre die Hälfte des Tomatensugos unter und würze mit Salz und Pfeffer.

Gib die Zwiebelmasse in eine große Auflaufform und verteile sie gleichmäßig. Schichte nun abwechselnd Auberginen-, Kartoffel- und Zucchinischeiben über die Zwiebelmasse. Würze mit Salz und Pfeffer und beträufle alles mit 2 EL Olivenöl.
steps.notes: Verwende bei 4 Personen 2 Auflaufformen.

steps.instruction: Bereite in einer großen Schüssel das Dressing zu: Verrühre Balsamicoessig, Olivenöl, Wasser, Salz, Pfeffer und eine Prise Zucker. Hacke die Walnüsse grob und füge sie zum Dressing hinzu.

Halbiere die Oliven und gib sie zusammen mit dem restlichen Tomatensugo über das Gemüse. Zerzupfe den Mozzarella und verteile ihn mit der Hälfte des geraspelten Hartkäses auf dem Gemüse. Backe das Ganze ca. 10 Minuten, bis der Mozzarella zerlaufen ist.
steps.notes: Oliven halbieren.

steps.instruction: Verteile den Rucola in der großen Schüssel und mische ihn mit dem Dressing und den restlichen Walnüssen sowie den restlichen Hartkäseflocken. Verteile Ofen-Ratatouille und Salat auf den Tellern und genieße.

miniballs-with-chili-mayo-and-vegetable-.title: Mini Meatballs with Chili Mayonnaise and Vegetable Salad
miniballs-with-chili-mayo-and-vegetable-.description: Small meatballs with spicy chili mayonnaise and fresh vegetable salad made from carrots, cucumbers and radishes – a delicious and easy dish for 2 to 4 people.

steps.instruction: Wash the lime with hot water and zest the peel. In a large bowl, knead the minced meat with 1 tsp (for 2 people), 1.5 tsp (3 people) or 2 tsp (4 people) lime zest, sweet chili sauce, some salt and pepper. Form 12 (2 people), 18 (3 people) or 24 (4 people) mini meatballs from the mixture and refrigerate briefly.
Peel the carrots and slice into thin long strips. Cut the cucumber into thin slices. Coarsely grate the radishes. Pick the mint leaves and chop finely. Halve the lime.

Squeeze the lime into a large bowl and mix with 1 tbsp (2 servings), 1 tbsp (3 servings) or 2 tbsp (4 servings) sugar and remaining lime zest to make a dressing. Add cucumber slices, carrot strips, grated radishes and chopped mint, stir and let marinate.
steps.notes: let the dressing marinate

steps.instruction: Bake the bread in the oven for 5-8 minutes until crispy. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise with sriracha sauce. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
steps.notes: bake bread in the oven

steps.instruction: Heat 1 tbsp (2 servings), 1.5 tbsp (3 servings) or 2 tbsp (4 servings) oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the mini meatballs to the pan, press them slightly flat and fry for 3-4 minutes per side until the meat is cooked through. Meanwhile, halve the bread vertically, cut open the bread halves (not all the way through) and spread with chili mayonnaise.
steps.notes: press mini meatballs flat for even cooking

steps.instruction: Top the bread halves with cucumber slices and arrange mini meatballs on top. Top with carrot and radishes and add coriander to taste. Fold the bread together and enjoy with the remaining salad.
steps.notes: Tip: Coriander has a distinctive taste, try it before using it.

hahnchenbrust-mit-brokkoli-paprikasosse-.title: Chicken Breast with Broccoli & Paprika Sauce
hahnchenbrust-mit-brokkoli-paprikasosse-.description: Crispy chicken breast fillets with broccoli, jasmine rice and a delicious paprika sauce. A balanced dish for 2 to 4 people.

ingredients.name: oil
ingredients.notes: for drizzling on chicken breasts and frying the paprika sauce

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.notes: for cooking rice, boiling broccoli and preparing sauce

ingredients.name: salt
ingredients.notes: for seasoning water, rice, broccoli and sauce

steps.instruction: Rinse the rice in a sieve with cold water until the water runs clear. Fill a small pot with 300 ml [450 ml | 600 ml] hot water, add a little salt and bring to the boil. Stir in the rice and simmer covered on low heat for about 10 minutes. Then remove the pot from the heat and let it stand covered for at least 10 minutes.
steps.notes: be sure to rinse the rice well beforehand

steps.instruction: Mix the panko breadcrumbs and grated hard cheese together on a deep plate. Place the chicken breasts in a large bowl and coat completely with mayonnaise until fully covered. Roll the chicken breasts in the cheese-panko mixture and press firmly. Spread the breaded chicken breasts on a baking tray lined with baking paper, drizzle with 1 tbsp [1.5 tbsp | 2 tbsp] oil and bake in the preheated oven at 220°C top/bottom heat (200°C fan) for 14-18 minutes until golden brown and no longer pink inside.
steps.notes: preheat oven to 220°C

steps.instruction: Fill a large pot with plenty of hot water, add salt and bring to the boil. Halve the bell pepper, remove the core and cut the pepper halves into 1 cm thin strips. Cut or break the broccoli into bite-sized florets.
steps.notes: prepare broccoli and bell pepper while the chicken is baking

steps.instruction: Heat 1 tbsp [1.5 tbsp | 2 tbsp] oil in a large pan and sauté the pepper strips for 4-6 minutes without browning. Deglaze the pan contents with 50 ml [75 ml | 100 ml] water, chicken stock powder, "Hello Paprika" seasoning mix and cooking cream, stir everything and simmer for another 2 minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook the broccoli florets in the large pot for 3-4 minutes until tender, then drain through a sieve.
After cooking, fluff the rice a little with a fork. Arrange the crispy chicken breasts, broccoli, rice and paprika sauce on plates and enjoy.

glasnudelsalat-mit-hackfleisch-und-gemue.title: Glass Noodle Salad with Minced Meat and Vegetables
glasnudelsalat-mit-hackfleisch-und-gemue.description: A delicious glass noodle salad with minced meat, fresh vegetables and a spicy dressing with lime, soy sauce and chili.

ingredients.name: glass noodles
ingredients.notes: note: the quantity changes when soaked

ingredients.name: spring onion
ingredients.notes: cut white and green parts separately

ingredients.name: courgette
ingredients.notes: trim ends, halve lengthwise and slice into strips

steps.instruction: Halve the chili, deseed and finely chop the chili halves (careful: hot!). Cut the white and green parts of the spring onions separately into fine rings. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Peel the carrot and slice into long strips with a vegetable peeler. Trim the ends of the courgette, halve lengthwise and slice into strips with a vegetable peeler.
steps.notes: tip: if slicing is too laborious, you can also cut courgette and carrot into thin slices or sticks

steps.instruction: Wash the lime with hot water, finely zest the peel and quarter the lime. In a small bowl, mix lime zest, juice from 2 lime quarters, soy sauce, chopped chili to taste and a pinch of sugar into a dressing.

Fill a large pot with plenty of hot water, add a generous amount of salt and bring to the boil. Remove the pot from the heat and soak the glass noodles in it for 5-7 minutes until soft. After cooking, drain the glass noodles in a sieve, rinse with cold water and let drain.
Heat 1-2 tsp oil in a large pan. Fry the minced meat in it for 6-8 minutes until crumbly and cooked through and all liquid has evaporated. Turn off the heat and stir in the bulgogi sauce.

Heat 1-2 tsp oil in a second pan, add the white part of the spring onion, chopped garlic, sliced carrots and courgette and sauté for 3-5 minutes. Add the glass noodles and dressing, mix well and fry for 1-2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Pick the coriander leaves and chop finely.

Divide the glass noodle salad onto plates and arrange the minced meat alongside. Top with peanuts and the green part of the spring onion. Sprinkle with chopped coriander and chili to taste. Serve with the remaining lime wedges.

zucchini-schinken-birne-salat-mit-pinien.title: Courgette, Ham and Pear Salad with Pine Nuts
zucchini-schinken-birne-salat-mit-pinien.description: A fresh and delicious salad featuring thin courgette slices, ham, pear wedges, grated hard cheese, pine nuts and pomegranate seeds, enhanced with a dressing and balsamic cream.

steps.instruction: Cut off the ends of the courgettes. Slice or shave the courgettes into 2-3 mm thin slices. Place the slices on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, drizzle with 1 tbsp oil (for 4 servings, adjust accordingly for other servings), and season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 10-15 minutes until soft and starting to brown.
steps.notes: Preheat the oven to 220 °C conventional heat.

steps.instruction: Cut the pear into eighths and remove the core. Halve the pomegranate, gently squeeze each half around, and hold over a small bowl. Tap the outside with a spoon to release the seeds. Wash the lemon in hot water, zest it, and quarter it.
Cut the slices of cured ham lengthwise in half and wrap each piece around a pear wedge.
Toast the pine nuts in a large pan without fat for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Watch carefully as pine nuts burn quickly.
steps.notes: Be careful not to burn them.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together 2 tbsp oil (for 2 servings, 4 tbsp for 4 servings), the juice of 1-2 lemon quarters, salt, pepper and a pinch of sugar to make a dressing. Just before serving, marinate the rocket in the dressing. Warm 1 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the ham-wrapped pear wedges for 3-4 minutes all around until the ham is crispy.

Arrange the courgette slices in circles on plates. Drizzle with some dressing and balsamic cream. Sprinkle with grated hard cheese, toasted pine nuts and a pinch of lemon zest. Pile the marinated rocket in the centre. Place the ham pear wedges on top and garnish with pomegranate seeds.

gemuese-lachs-mit-porree-und-linsen-en-G.title: Vegetable Salmon with Leek and Lentils
gemuese-lachs-mit-porree-und-linsen-en-G.description: A delicious dish with carrots, celery, leek, chilli, and lentils, served with salmon. Easy to prepare and perfect for 2-4 people.

ingredients.name: Carrot
ingredients.notes: Peel the carrot and cut into small cubes.

ingredients.name: Leek
ingredients.notes: Cut the leek into 0.5 cm wide rings.

ingredients.name: Red chilli
ingredients.notes: Chilli is hot, halve, remove seeds, and cut into fine pieces.

ingredients.name: Chives/Thyme
ingredients.notes: Pick thyme leaves and roughly chop, cut chives into fine rings.

ingredients.name: Vegetable stock
ingredients.notes: Vegetable stock powder for the sauce.

ingredients.name: Salt*
ingredients.notes: To season the vegetables and the sauce.

ingredients.name: Oil
ingredients.notes: For frying the vegetables and seasoning the salmon fillets.

steps.instruction: Peel the carrot. Cut carrot and celery stick into small cubes. Slice leek into 0.5 cm rings. Halve chilli lengthwise, remove seeds and cut chilli halves into fine pieces. (Caution: hot!)
Pick leaves from thyme and roughly chop. Cut chives into fine rings.

Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add carrot and celery cubes, leek rings, chilli pieces (caution: hot!), chopped thyme and chives to the pan and fry for 8-12 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Season with salt.
steps.notes: Vegetables must be soft.

steps.instruction: Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper and 1 tbsp oil. Bake salmon on a baking tray lined with baking paper in a preheated oven at 220°C top/bottom heat (200°C fan) for 12-14 minutes until the fish is no longer translucent inside.
steps.notes: Preheat oven.

steps.instruction: Rinse lentils in a sieve under cold water until the water runs clear. Add lentils to the vegetables. Add vegetable stock powder and cream to vegetables and bring to the boil again until the sauce is creamy and thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve creamy leek vegetables on plates, arrange salmon on top and enjoy.

bulgur-spitzpaprika-salat-mit-avocado-un.title: Bulgur Pointed Pepper Salad with Avocado and Onion-Yoghurt Dip
bulgur-spitzpaprika-salat-mit-avocado-un.description: A fresh salad with cooked bulgur, roasted pointed peppers, caramelised onions and a mint yoghurt dip, served with avocado and spinach. Perfect for 2 to 4 people as a healthy meal.

ingredients.name: Pistachios
ingredients.notes: Coarsely chopped, for filling the pointed peppers

ingredients.name: Feta cheese
ingredients.notes: To crumble inside the pointed peppers

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.notes: To drizzle over the pointed peppers and for the dip

steps.instruction: Fill a small pot with 350 ml (for 2 people) / 470 ml (for 3 people) / 700 ml (for 4 people) boiling water. Add seasoning mix and salt, bring to a boil once. Stir in bulgur and simmer covered on low heat for about 15 minutes. Then remove pot from heat and let it stand covered for at least 10 minutes.
steps.notes: Bring water to the boil, then cook bulgur.

steps.instruction: Halve the pointed peppers, remove seeds and stalks. Place pointed peppers on a baking tray lined with baking paper and drizzle with 1 tbsp (for 2 people), 1.5 tbsp (for 3 people) or 2 tbsp (for 4 people) olive oil. Coarsely chop the pistachios. Crumble feta cheese with your hands into the pointed peppers. Sprinkle pistachios over. Bake in the middle of the oven for 15–20 minutes until the pointed peppers are soft.
steps.notes: Preheat oven to 220°C (conventional).
ingredients: Spitzpaprika (nicht in ingredient list, use 2-4 depending)

steps.instruction: Pluck leaves from parsley and mint and finely chop separately. Peel onion, halve and slice finely. Heat 1 tbsp (for 2 people), 1.5 tbsp (for 3 people) or 2 tbsp (for 4 people) olive oil in a small pan. Sauté onion strips on medium heat for 8–10 minutes until translucent. Deglaze with balsamic glaze and leave on the switched-off stove.
steps.notes: Slowly sauté onions until translucent.

steps.instruction: Wash the lime thoroughly and finely grate the zest. Cut lime into 6 (for 2 people), 6 (for 3 people) or 12 (for 4 people) wedges. In a large bowl, whisk together juice of 1 (2P), 1.5 (3P) or 2 (4P) lime wedges, 1 tbsp (2P), 1.5 tbsp (3P) or 2 tbsp (4P) olive oil, sweet mustard, salt and pepper. Fold in spinach.
steps.notes: Make dressing and fold in spinach.

steps.instruction: In a small bowl, mix creamy yoghurt with mint and a few drops of lime juice. Season with salt and pepper. Halve avocado, remove stone, scoop out flesh and slice crosswise.
steps.notes: Prepare fresh mint yoghurt dip.

steps.instruction: Mix bulgur with juice of 1 (2P), 1.5 (3P) or 2 (4P) lime wedges to taste, chopped parsley and 1 tsp (2P), 1.5 tsp (3P) or 2 tsp (4P) lime zest and place on deep plates. Arrange spinach salad, avocado, pointed peppers and caramelised onions on top and enjoy with mint yoghurt.
steps.notes: Arrange all attractively and serve.

vegetarische-moussaka-mit-aubergine-lins.title: Vegetarian Moussaka with Aubergine and Lentils
vegetarische-moussaka-mit-aubergine-lins.description: A delicious vegetarian moussaka with aubergines, lentils and potato cubes, topped with a cream cheese mixture and cheese blend. Perfect for 2 to 4 people.

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.notes: for aubergine slices and baking dish

steps.instruction: Drain the lentils through a sieve and rinse under running water until the water runs clear. Trim the ends off the aubergine and slice into approx. 0.5 cm thick slices.

In a large baking dish, combine chopped tomatoes, lentils, potato cubes, vegetable stock, honey and "Hello Souflaki" seasoning mix. Season with sugar, salt and pepper, then spread evenly across the bottom of the baking dish.
steps.notes: For 4 people, it is best to use 2 baking dishes.

steps.instruction: Spread the aubergine slices on half of a baking tray lined with baking paper. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 220 °C (top/bottom heat) for about 20 minutes until slightly softened.
steps.notes: Use a whole baking tray for 3 or 4 people.

steps.instruction: Mix cream cheese and "Hello Nutmeg" seasoning mix smoothly with hot water. Cut the tomato into 2 cm cubes. Halve the romaine lettuce heart, remove the core and slice into strips.

Remove the baking dish from the oven and mix well. Distribute the pre-baked aubergine slices over the dish, add the cream cheese mixture on top, sprinkle with the cheese blend, and gratinate in the oven for another 10–12 minutes. Afterwards, wipe the baking dish with kitchen paper.

In a large bowl, whisk together balsamic cream and olive oil. Season the dressing with salt and pepper. Fold the tomato and salad into the dressing. Serve the vegetarian moussaka on plates with salad on the side and enjoy.

ofen-ratatouille-mit-walnussen-und-mozza.title: Oven Ratatouille with Walnuts and Mozzarella
ofen-ratatouille-mit-walnussen-und-mozza.description: A delicious oven-baked ratatouille with aubergines, courgettes, potatoes, walnuts, and mozzarella, topped with hard cheese flakes, served with a fresh rocket salad and dressing.

steps.instruction: Wash the vegetables. Preheat the oven to 220°C top/bottom heat (200°C fan). Trim the ends of the aubergine and courgette and cut into slices about 0.5 cm thick. Peel the potato and cut into 0.5 cm thick slices. Peel the onion, halve it, and cut into fine half rings. Peel the garlic.
steps.notes: To prevent the aubergine from tasting bitter, salt immediately after cutting and blot dry after about 10 minutes.

steps.instruction: Toast the walnut kernels in a large pan without fat for 2–3 minutes until they start to smell fragrant. Remove and let cool. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in the pan, add the onion, press in the garlic and sauté both for 2–3 minutes until translucent. Add the seasoning mix "Hello Harissa" and roast all together briefly. Stir in half of the tomato sugo and season with salt and pepper.

Place the onion mixture in a large casserole dish and spread evenly. Layer aubergine, potato, and courgette slices alternately over the onion mixture. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle everything with 2 tbsp olive oil.
steps.notes: For 4 people, use 2 casserole dishes.

steps.instruction: Prepare the dressing in a large bowl: whisk balsamic vinegar, olive oil, water, salt, pepper and a pinch of sugar. Roughly chop the walnuts and add them to the dressing.

Halve the olives and place them along with the remaining tomato sugo over the vegetables. Tear the mozzarella and distribute it with half the grated hard cheese over the vegetables. Bake the whole dish for about 10 minutes until the mozzarella has melted.
steps.notes: Halve the olives.

steps.instruction: Spread the rocket in the large bowl and mix it with the dressing, the remaining walnuts, and the remaining hard cheese flakes. Divide oven ratatouille and salad onto plates and enjoy.

beef-burger-garden-style-risotto-en-GB.title: Beef Burger Garden Style Risotto
beef-burger-garden-style-risotto-en-GB.description: A delicious risotto with mushrooms, bacon, pear, walnuts, and caramelised flavours, topped with grated hard cheese and chives.

ingredients.name: Olive oil, water, sugar, salt, pepper
ingredients.notes: used as needed for cooking and seasoning

steps.instruction: In a large pot, heat 1 tbsp olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic for about 1 minute. Add risotto rice and sauté for another minute. Deglaze with a little chicken stock and cook risotto over low heat for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally and gradually adding stock as needed.
steps.notes: Stir continuously to prevent sticking.

steps.instruction: Slice mushrooms. Quarter the pear, remove the core, and halve the pieces again. Cut chives into fine rings.
Place bacon slices in a large cold pan and fry over medium heat for about 5 minutes, turning occasionally until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Using the same pan without adding fat, fry sliced mushrooms for 3-4 minutes, season with salt and pepper, then add to the risotto.
Wipe the pan with kitchen paper, then add pear slices and walnuts. Fry for about 3 minutes. Sprinkle 0.5 to 1 tbsp sugar over and let caramelise gently for 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir grated hard cheese into the finished risotto, then spread on plates. Top with caramelised pear slices, walnuts, crispy bacon slices, and sprinkle with chive rings. Serve and enjoy.

bulgogi-sweet-chili-burger-with-roasted-.title: Bulgogi Sweet Chilli Burger with Roasted Vegetable Slices
bulgogi-sweet-chili-burger-with-roasted-.description: A flavourful recipe featuring bulgogi-seasoned ground beef burgers paired with sweet chilli mayonnaise and roasted vegetable slices, including sweet potato and green beans, served with a baguette.

ingredients.name: Stone-baked baguette
ingredients.notes: Use 1 to 2 pieces depending on serving size

ingredients.name: Green bell pepper
ingredients.notes: Halved, deseeded, cut into 1 cm wide strips

ingredients.name: Sweet potato
ingredients.notes: Halved lengthwise, then quartered lengthwise and sliced into 1 cm thick pieces

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220°C (top and bottom heat) or 200°C (fan). Gather 1 baking dish, 1 baking tray lined with baking paper, a small bowl, and a vegetable grater.
steps.notes: Oven preheated before starting preparation.

steps.instruction: Peel the onion, quarter it and separate the layers. Halve the green bell pepper, remove seeds and stem, then cut into 1 cm wide strips. Halve the sweet potato lengthwise, then quarter lengthwise and slice into 1 cm thick slices.
steps.notes: Prepare vegetables before mixing.

steps.instruction: Put the ground beef, quartered onion, and green pepper strips into a baking dish. Add bulgogi sauce and sesame seeds, then mix well.
steps.notes: Mix thoroughly to distribute sauce and seeds.

steps.instruction: Peel and coarsely grate the carrot. Pick coriander leaves. Halve the baguette crosswise and then slice horizontally.
steps.notes: Prepare carrot and baguette for assembly.

steps.instruction: In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and sweet chilli sauce with salt and pepper to make the dip. Stir well.
steps.notes: Adjust seasoning to taste.

steps.instruction: Place the baking dish on one side of the baking tray lined with baking paper. Arrange the sweet potato slices on the other side. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Bake everything in the middle of the oven for 25-30 minutes. Add the baguette during the last 5-10 minutes of baking time.
steps.notes: If space is tight, you can use two baking trays.

steps.instruction: Put the grated carrot into the baking dish and mix with the bulgogi mixture. Spread both sides of the baguette with the sweet chilli mayonnaise. Fill the baguette with the bulgogi mixture and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve the sweet potato slices with the remaining sweet chilli mayonnaise.
steps.notes: Assemble while filling is warm for best flavour.
